content.html: I started the year in Covid isolation, lying in bed watching all of the Karate Kid movies back-to-back, and ended the year with a long-awaited holiday to New York, something that seemed impossible to contemplate a year or two ago. Although the pandemic is certainly not over, planning for the future is once again on the table.
content.value: I started the year in Covid isolation, lying in bed watching all of the Karate Kid movies back-to-back, and ended the year with a long-awaited holiday to New York, something that seemed impossible to contemplate a year or two ago. Although the pandemic is certainly not over, planning for the future is once again on the table.

name: My 2022 in books, films and music

content.html: Year sixteen of sitting myself down in front of the computer on New Year's Eve and totting up (almost) everything I read, watched or listened to over the previous twelve months. I'm not even sure whether I enjoy this exercise any more, but it's been a thing for too long to give it up now.
content.value: Year sixteen of sitting myself down in front of the computer on New Year's Eve and totting up (almost) everything I read, watched or listened to over the previous twelve months. I'm not even sure whether I enjoy this exercise any more, but it's been a thing for too long to give it up now.

content.html: No creator was born making hits. It’s delusional to think you’re the exception.
content.value: No creator was born making hits. It’s delusional to think you’re the exception.

content.html: I don't think I've ever given up on a book as quickly as I did with this one. A more generous reader might label it avant-garde; the Guardian blurb on the front says "surreal", but personally I'd go with pretentious and unfunny.
content.value: I don't think I've ever given up on a book as quickly as I did with this one. A more generous reader might label it avant-garde; the Guardian blurb on the front says "surreal", but personally I'd go with pretentious and unfunny.

content.html: One thing I'm not sure about how to handle on this site is the relative heading levels of, well, headings -- specifically when displaying an article on the site home page compared to on its own individual page.
content.value: One thing I'm not sure about how to handle on this site is the relative heading levels of, well, headings -- specifically when displaying an article on the site home page compared to on its own individual page.

content.html: In drawing up a list of potential functionality for a new blog platform, it's tempting to tell yourself that you're going to avoid simply copying how WordPress does it. Yet, as soon as you come to start listing out features you'd like to have, it does start to read a little like the WP sidebar.
content.value: In drawing up a list of potential functionality for a new blog platform, it's tempting to tell yourself that you're going to avoid simply copying how WordPress does it. Yet, as soon as you come to start listing out features you'd like to have, it does start to read a little like the WP sidebar.

content.html: I've decided that to keep myself entertained I'm going to build a new blog engine for myself, and dogfood the development as I go by returning to regular blogging on this site.
content.value: I've decided that to keep myself entertained I'm going to build a new blog engine for myself, and dogfood the development as I go by returning to regular blogging on this site.
